8.7.19  12:10 pm   Serious question: your music has a masterful way of building tension and then resolving it; using both clever chord progressions and cadences as well as melodic fills-- then it swings effortlessly back into a catchy hook or chorus. This honestly feels similar to how baroque music works. What is your thought process when you compose these things? Is it instinct, or is all of this meticulously planned using advanced music theory? Anyway, sorry for the long question, big fan and fellow musician here trying to analyze your style.
